data.title: Super Soundtrack: “grown-ish” on Freeform [Season 4]
data.meta_description: "grown-ish" is back on Freeform, and it's graduation season!
data.text:
grown-ish is back on Freeform, and it’s graduation season! This senior year cast includes Yara Shahidi, Trevor Jackson, Francia Raisa, Luka Sabbat, Emily Arlook, Chlöe Bailey, Halle Bailey, Jordan Buhat, and Diggy Simmons.

This is one of those series aimed at older teens and younger twenty-somethings that accurately portrays what the college experience is actually like in real life. One big part of that is the fact that it features music that specific age range is actually listening to right now. Another aspect of the show I love is how every episode is titled after a popular song or album title, but even more than that, they are aptly suited to the content of that episode. I just think that’s such a unique and special component of the series.

Let’s get into the music featured this season on grown-ish…

Season 4, Episode 10: “It Was Good Until It Wasn’t”

“Toxic” by Kehlani

Heard at the very beginning of the episode while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) is giving her voiceover recap

“Grown” by Chloe x Halle

Heard as the theme song over the opening credits of every episode

“Give Me A Reason” by R.LUM.R

Heard while Nomi (Emily Arlook) is listening to a voicemail from Phil

“Strange” by Celeste

Heard while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) and Luca (Luka Sabbt) have a serious conversation

Season 4, Episode 11: “Movin’ Different”

“Fall Back” by TT The Artist ft. Shiftee

Heard during the “previously on” recap

“Back in the Day” by Add-2 ft. Brittney Carter, Oliv Blue & Phonto

Heard while Doug (Diggy Simmons) is on a date

“Days Roll By” by Hubert Hitchon & Isla Moony

Heard while Aaron (Trevor Jackson) is setting up his new classroom with “a salon-type vibe”

“Calm Down” by Brain Tan ft. Fusilier

Heard while Doug (Diggy Simmons) is on his date

“Are You All Good?” by Breathe.

Heard while Ana (Francia Raisa) is waiting in the police station

Season 4, Episode 12: “Mr. Right Now”

“My House” by The O’My’s

Heard while Nomi (Emily Arlook) is watching Phil and Alina play together

“Mirror’s Eye / Going Within” by CAPYAC, Def Sound & Annabelle Magginis

Heard playing in the background

Season 4, Episode 13: “OK Not To Be OK”

“Better Safe Than Social” by The Last Artful & Dodgr

Heard playing during Zoey’s (Yara Shahidi) voiceover about Jazz’s (Chlöe Bailey) new gloomy mood

“Inside” by Dumbfoundead & SATICA

Heard while Ana (Francia Raisa) and Aaron (Trevor Jackson) are talking in his apartment

Season 4, Episode 14: “The Revolution Will Not Be Televised”

“I Love It” by King Green

Heard at the beginning of the episode while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) is doing her voiceover to talk about Aaron’s (Trevor Jackson) Afro-Salon

“Frontin’ Like Pharrell” by DijahSB

Heard while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) and Luca (Luka Sabbat) are working on their collection for Tyler, The Creator

“Sister” by TSHA

Heard while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) and Luca (Luka Sabbat) are taking a break from work at a swingset

“Amazing Grace”

Heard when Aaron (Trevor Jackson) sings it during his Uni Talk presentation run through

Season 4, Episode 15: “Can’t Let Go”

“Wasted Youth” by Diana Gordon

Heard when Luca (Luka Sabbat) is coming out of the building while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) is walking in

“Missing Out” by Syd

Heard while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) and Luca (Luka Sabbat) are sitting on the stairs talking

Season 4, Episode 16: “Live Your Life”

“Stay With It” by Rich

Heard playing at the very beginning of the episode

“When Love Is Gone” by Jason Tarver & Blake Devon

Heard playing during the funeral scene

Season 4, Episode 17: “Laugh Now Cry Later”

“Love Don’t Change” by Trevor Jackson

Heard at the very beginning of the episode while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) and Aaron (Trevor Jackson) are talking while laying in bed together

“Kacey Talk” by YoungBoy Never Broke Again

Heard playing at the party before Aaron (Trevor Jackson) asks them to cut the music to give a speech

“Do It Right” by Mega. & Kwini Rene

Heard playing at the party

“Tell Em I’ll Watch” by Alexander Hitchens & Mark James

Heard playing at the party

“Don’t Forget About Me” by Cloves

Heard when Aaron (Trevor Jackson) gives Zoey (Yara Shahidi) a necklace as a gift

“Damaged” by Lani Rose

Heard playing during a series of scenes involving different characters

Season 4, Episode 18: “Empire State of Mind”

“Memories” by Maroon 5

Heard playing over a montage of scenes from the graduation party

“Are We In A Dream” by Black Red Gold & Greg Critchley

Heard when Zoey (Yara Shahidi) wakes up on the rooftop at sunrise

“Your Turn” by Ty Dolla $ign ft. Musiq Soulchild, Tish Hyman & 6LACK

Heard playing after Zoey (Yara Shahidi) talks to her dad (Anthony Anderson)

“You’re Mines Still” by Yung Bleu ft. Drake

Heard while Zoey (Yara Shahidi) is walking the streets of New York

“Walk in Like a Boss” by SKRXLLA

Heard when Zoey’s brother, Andre (Marcus Scribner) is seen walking onto the Cal U campus
